main event: An object was observed in the sky moving from East to West-North-West for 5 seconds on August 5, 1956, in Colonial Hill.
interesting points: The object was amber in color and very bright., The object was large in size., The object disappeared rapidly from view., The observation was conducted via ground-radar., The case is classified as probably bona fide rather than due to astronomical or weather phenomena.
sighted object: an amber colored large object in the sky
witness description: A 34-year-old Pennsylvania Air Force Station member.
